hydro_io

hydroroot.hydro_io.export_mtg_to_aqua_file(g, filename='out.csv')[source]

Export a MTG architecture in a csv file into format used by aquaporin team

Parameters

  • g – MTG

  • filename – string (Default value = “out.csv”)

  • The – file format is 3 columns separated by tab

  • 1st – col

  • 2nd – col

  • 3d – col

  • It – uses only the mtg properties

  • simulated – architecture

  • At – this stage

hydroroot.hydro_io.export_mtg_to_rsml(g_discrete, filename=None, segment_length=0.0001)[source]

Export a discrete MTG architecture into a rsml file or return a continuous MTG according to the parameters (see below) only the geometry is exported no other properties

Parameters

  • g_c – MTG

  • filename – string (Default value = None)

  • segment_length – float (Default value = 1.0e-4)

  • Remark – g_discrete from hydroroot has length and radius in

  • Remark – At this stage

  • in – hydroponic solution

  • Does – not overwrite the MTG in input

  • 1st – use a turtle to get position in 3D

  • use – functions from hydroroot

  • in – display

  • 2d – insert scales

  • MTG – from hydroroot has only segment scale

  • add – the axes scale

  • add – the plant scale

  • end – up with

  • 3d – convert the discrete MTG to continuous

  • MTG – without the finest scale

  • 4th – write to the file

  • g_discrete –

hydroroot.hydro_io.import_rsml_to_discrete_mtg(g_c, segment_length=0.0001, resolution=0.0001)[source]
Parameters

  • g_c –

  • segment_length – (Default value = 1.0e-4)

  • resolution – (Default value = 1.0e-4)
